poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: Flaws in the rock. Fern fronds. Frogs agog In fobs of water. His gunsight fogs And foils the hunter. Fawns and does consider him Then leave with the light. Lucifer, when you ponder it, is the dark. No blame. Night falls and forms shift, there's no clear shot Where blustered bracken flogs the Atlantic spray And starry clusters, faint as phosphorus all asplutter in the deep.
